result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus B Lopez-Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesus B Lopez-Martinez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesus B Lopez-Martinez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Jesus B Lopez-Martinez was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Mark Maciolek
Adjudication/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan;  Interpreter Fayme F. (duly sworn)
Defendant appeared.  William Leroy Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin; Defn not eligible for SPD; Defn applied for court appointed counsel on 9-1-16 (denied) and then filed an appeal on the same day (which the court never received); Court reviewed the appeal just prior to going on the record in today's hearing and upheld the denial; Defn advised he would like an attorney; Court will reschedule adjudication/sentencing hearing one last time; If defn appears at the next hearing without an atty, the court may find he has wavied his right to counsel
Order for appointment of counsel - approved (CDP attorney not appointed as defn hired his own attorney).

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with  J.C.L. or Sara L. unless modified by a family court order.
- Defendant shall not be in the 100 block of Janesville St in Oregon, WI unless modified by a family court order.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
Trial Court Br 7

Defendant in court with Attorney Roberto R. Ledesma.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jim Larson, interpreter, appeared. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  
The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
